update.description:
This is needed by the FTU tutorial. The plugin is for demonstrations purposes and makes a couple of assumptions: The parent model needs to have differential drive capability and a forward looking depth camera sensor

The plugin finds closest object using depth camera sensor and sets the velocities of the joints to move towards the direction of the object

see [pull request #180](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-requests/180/add-follower-vehicle-model/diff) in the gazebo_models repo for the accompanying follower vehicle model that uses this plugin

thanks to @caguero for the help on this plugin
update.title: Add FollowerPlugin for FTU tutorial

content.raw:
I think the casts have to be updated:

~~~
/home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazeboB/plugins/FollowerPlugin.cc: In member function ‘bool gazebo::FollowerPlugin::FindSensor(const ModelPtr&)’:
/home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazeboB/plugins/FollowerPlugin.cc:198:75: error: no matching function for call to ‘dynamic_pointer_cast(gazebo::sensors::SensorPtr&)’
             boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<sensors::DepthCameraSensor>(sensor);
                                                                           ^
/home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazeboB/plugins/FollowerPlugin.cc:198:75: note: candidate is:
In file included from /usr/include/boost/shared_ptr.hpp:17:0,
                 from /home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazeboB/gazebo/common/CommonTypes.hh:24,
                 from /home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazeboB/gazebo/common/Plugin.hh:44,
                 from /home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazeboB/plugins/FollowerPlugin.cc:27:
/usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp:808:42: note: template<class T, class U> boost::shared_ptr<X> boost::dynamic_pointer_cast(const boost::shared_ptr<U>&)
 template<class T, class U> shared_ptr<T> dynamic_pointer_cast( shared_ptr<U> const & r ) BOOST_NOEXCEPT
                                          ^
/usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp:808:42: note:   template argument deduction/substitution failed:
/home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazeboB/plugins/FollowerPlugin.cc:198:75: note:   ‘gazebo::sensors::SensorPtr {aka std::shared_ptr<gazebo::sensors::Sensor>}’ is not derived from ‘const boost::shared_ptr<U>’
             boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<sensors::DepthCameraSensor>(sensor);
~~~

content.raw:
ya looks like the nested model pose is not reset properly. Fixed in b81ff0b and added a test. 

Queued a jenkins [no gpu job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-none/45/)

ya looks like the nested model pose is not reset properly. Fixed in b81ff0b and added a test.

content.raw: It might not be related to this PR, but when I reset the world, the vehicle flies. Doing it with the world paused shows the sensor pose is not correct at the beginning.
content.html: It might not be related to this PR, but when I reset the world, the vehicle flies. Doing it with the world paused shows the sensor pose is not correct at the beginning.
This is really really cool

content.raw:
So is the vehicle supposed to stop if it hits something? Right now it is pushing a sphere, which I actually find really cool :) 

It might be because the sphere is touching the robot, not the sensor?

nvidia gpu - ok

no gpu - ok

homebrew - ok
